intro: Urena lappago, commonly known as velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-centered flowers. It thrives in warm climates and is often found in disturbed soils. Urena lappago is also known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and vegetative means.
